alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY WET SNOW POSSIBLE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY... A potent low pressure system will affect the region late Wednesday through Friday this week. Locally heavy precipitation will be possible with this system, with the potential for one to two inches of liquid water. In addition, rain will change to snow Thursday as temperatures fall, starting with the higher elevations above 6 thousand feet early Thursday. Snow levels will fall through the day as temperatures fall. Although there is much uncertainty lingering with this system, there is the potential for several inches of wet heavy snow, especially above 5 thousand feet. Stay informed via our website, social media pages, or your local media for the latest updates on this storm.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
